channel.title: Help SAVE The INTERNET
channel.description: http://www.savetheinternet.com/ Help save the internet and keep it FREE! Tell all your freinds and everyone to sign the petition

item.title: Help SAVE The INTERNET
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

You are STILL not understanding what “free” means.

Besides that, you make no sense at all. “The internet should be free because it is a network”. I’m well aware of what the internet is, by the way, but ok.

The telecom system is a network too, I pay for a phone line.
The national grid, is a network.

It costs money to keep you online. Why should the ISPs just do it for free, like some kind of charity?

Oh and I’ll say it once more: THE ARTICLE REFERENCED IN THE ORIGINAL POST DOES NOT MEAN FREE IN THE MONETARY SENSE.

This post has been brought to you by Mopman.

Read full topic

item.title: Help SAVE The INTERNET
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

[quote=“Mopman, post:21, topic:37723”]Did you even read the website.

What is this about?

This is about Internet freedom. “Network Neutrality” – the First Amendment of the Internet – ensures that the public can view the smallest blog just as easily as the largest corporate Web site by preventing Internet companies like AT&T from rigging the playing field for only the highest-paying sites.

But Internet providers like AT&T, Verizon and Comcast are spending millions of dollars lobbying Congress to gut Net Neutrality. If Congress doesn’t take action now to implement meaningful Net Neutrality provisions, the future of the Internet is at risk.

FreeDOM.

EDIT: How is it stupid that ISPs charge you money to connect? They pay for the bandwidth, they pay for the routers you use to connect, they pay for the servers that run your email, etc.[/quote]

Yes, but it is still free because the internet is simply a giant connection of the computers of the work. Technically, the real name of the Internet should be International Network. Here are 5 definitions from Dictionary.com of the word Internet:

a large computer network linking smaller computer networks worldwide (usually prec. by the).
An interconnected system of networks that connects computers around the world via the TCP/IP protocol.
a computer network consisting of a worldwide network of computer networks that use the TCP/IP network protocols to facilitate data transmission and exchange
A system connecting computers around the world using TCP/IP, which stands for Transmission Control Protocol/Internet Protocol, a set of standards for transmitting and receiving digital data. The Internet consists primarily of the collection of billions of interconnected webpages that are transferred using HTTP (Hypertext Transfer Protocol), and are collectively known as the World Wide Web. The Internet also uses FTP (File Transfer Protocol) to transfer files, and SMTP (Simple Mail Transfer Protocol) to transfer e-mail.
The global communication network that allows almost all computers worldwide to connect and exchange information. Some of the early impetus for such a network came from the U.S. government network Arpanet, starting in the 1960s.

Read full topic

item.title: Help SAVE The INTERNET
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

Did you even read the website.

What is this about?

This is about Internet freedom. “Network Neutrality” – the First Amendment of the Internet – ensures that the public can view the smallest blog just as easily as the largest corporate Web site by preventing Internet companies like AT&T from rigging the playing field for only the highest-paying sites.

But Internet providers like AT&T, Verizon and Comcast are spending millions of dollars lobbying Congress to gut Net Neutrality. If Congress doesn’t take action now to implement meaningful Net Neutrality provisions, the future of the Internet is at risk.

FreeDOM.

EDIT: How is it stupid that ISPs charge you money to connect? They pay for the bandwidth, they pay for the routers you use to connect, they pay for the servers that run your email, etc.

Read full topic

item.title: Help SAVE The INTERNET
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

You guys are all kidding me. You are all telling me know one here actually knows what the ‘internet’ is??? Sigh, here I go:

There internet is a connection of computers around the world. They are connected into servers using firbre optic cables. This server hotspots are sometimes refered to as the “backbones” of the internet. The internet has always been free and always will be. It is the ISPs that charge people to connect into those backbones. If someone paid to have fibre optic cable to connect to the nearest backbone to their loaction, without an ISP, then they would have free internet. Please people, follow the moparisthebest rules and post things that are informative and useful, not things that are uneducated and void.

Read full topic
